Package de.oth.blocklib.helper

Class Maths

java.lang.Object
de.oth.blocklib.helper.Maths
public final class Maths
extends java.lang.Object
Extra Math functions to create view and transformation matrix.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Modifier Constructor Description
    private Maths()
    Because there should never be a instance of a utility class.

    • eulerToQuaternion

      public static org.lwjgl.util.vector.Quaternion eulerToQuaternion​(float x, float y, float z)
      Converts a rotation in euler-angle representation to a Quaternion
      Parameters:
      x - counter-clockwise rotation around the x-axis in radians
      y - counter-clockwise rotation around the y-axis in radians
      z - counter-clockwise rotation around the z-axis in radians
      Returns:
      Quaternion representing this euler rotation

    • eulerToQuaternion

      Converts a rotation in euler-angle representation to a Quaternion
      Parameters:
      euler - counter-clockwise rotation angles around x-, y- and z-axis in radians
      Returns:
      Quaternion representing this euler rotation

    • quaternionToEuler

      public static org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f quaternionToEuler​(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Quaternion q)
      Converts a rotation Quaternion to euler-angle representation
      Parameters:
      q - rotation to convert
      Returns:
      Vector containing the counter-clockwise rotation angles around the x-, y- and z-axis in radians

    • stochasticRound

      public static int stochasticRound​(float x, java.util.Random random)
      This function tries to round stochastically, meaning it will return (int) x if x is already an integer. If x is, for example, 14.2, it will return 14 80% of the time and 15 20% of the time.
      Parameters:
      x - the number to stochastically round
      random - the random instance to use
      Returns:
      the stochastic rounding result

    • stochasticRound

      public static int stochasticRound​(double x, java.util.Random random)
      This function tries to round stochastically, meaning it will return (int) x if x is already an integer. If x is, for example, 14.2, it will return 14 80% of the time and 15 20% of the time.
      Parameters:
      x - the number to stochastically round
      random - the random instance to use
      Returns:
      the stochastic rounding result

    • abs

      public static org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f abs​(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f src, org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f dest)
      Calculates the absolute values for each component of the vector and returns the resulting vector. 
       Example: Maths.abs(new Vector3f(1.2, -1.4, 0), null); // returns (1.2, 1.4, 0)
      If dest is null a new Vector is created.
      Parameters:
      src - The vector to calculate the absolute of
      dest - The vector in which the result is saved (can be null)
      Returns:
      The vector containing the absolute values.

    • toNextInt

      public static float toNextInt​(float value, float direction)
      Calculates the next integer to value when going in direction. 0 counts as positive direction. 
       Examples:
 Maths.toNextInt(0f,1f) // returns  1.0
 Maths.toNextInt(0f,-2.5f) // returns -1.0
 Maths.toNextInt(1.3f,1f) // returns  2.0
 Maths.toNextInt(-2.7f,1f) // returns -2.0
 Maths.toNextInt(-2.7f,-14f) // returns -3.0
      Parameters:
      value - Float from which to find the next integer
      direction - Direction in which to go to the next integer
      Returns:
      The integer following value

    • getMinIndex

      public static int getMinIndex​(float[] values)
      Returns the index of the minimal value in values.
      Parameters:
      values - non-null non-empty array in which to look for the minimum index
      Returns:
      The index of the minimal value in values

    • min

      public static float min​(float[] values)
      Returns the minimum value in an array of floats.
      Parameters:
      values - non-null non-empty array in which to look for the minimum
      Returns:
      The minimal value in values
